column4: I don't understand why I cannot write the Feisty alternate install iso to a 700MB cd, but it consistently fails. Checksum is okay for the iso file..
how does it fail? errmro messages aren't just for show
I have pastebinned the entire thing at http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/25994/ thank you for asking about that :)
you still haven't told us the error
I don't want to flood the channel; I have pastebinned the error at http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/25994/  (as I mentioned before)
does it always stop at the same place  "656 of  696MB written" ?
so far yes, it stops at same place; I suspect the CDs are junk
I asked you a question. I won't answer until you answer my questions too
I answered your question, but I think maybe you missed it amidst all the rest of the things you were doing: Yes, it makes the same error at 656 MB each time.
mikeyhatesms != Nutubuntu  ;)
he is not the only one who demands help but is not able to answer simple questions. lots of those here
n/p and thanks again
danny s right. record as image! that's important
danny, have been doing that, I promise ;) -- "True, I was born at night, but not LAST night"
yes
if you want them exactly anyways why do you want to install them not at once? what you do is usually done to not install all the "cruft", ie to get a lean system
in which case you don't want to install it just install what you actually need
I probably would like a leaner installation, so maybe it's good, but the reason I am not just letting the installation routine install them, is that it's breaking at that point. I don't know why yet.
e..g the gui you get via aptitude install x-window-syste ubuntu-dektop
e..g the gui you get via aptitude install x-window-syste ubuntu-desktop
